content.description: Recipes for the same type of cookies can vary in terms of ingredients and baking times. From a collection of chocolate chip cookie recipes, a baker randomly selected 5 recipes. From a collection of oatmeal raisin cookie recipes, the baker randomly selected 4 recipes. The mean baking times, in minutes, for each sample were recorded as <math alttext="x bar sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x bar sub O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively.
content.question: What is the correct unit of measure for the standard deviation of the sampling distribution of <math alttext="x bar sub C minus x bar sub O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>?

topic.text: 5.8: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Means

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
